Dear Ms. Waidelich:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
On 2/6/22, a staff member performed an improper restraint on a youth that was
attempting to self-harm.
INVESTIGATION:
On 2/11/22 a complaint was received from the facility indicating on 2/6/22 Staff 1
was called to assist with Youth A. While Staff 2 was de-escalating another youth
Staff 1 was attempting to de-escalate Youth A in the milieu. Youth A was holding a
plastic cup that she had broken into pieces. Staff 1 asked Youth A to give him the
pieces because they had sharp edges. Youth A refused to give them up. Youth A
swung at Staff 1 with the sharp pieces. Staff 1 then conducted an unapproved wrist
hold on Youth A to keep her from stabbing him with the broken plastic. Staff 1 held
Youth A’s wrists across the front of her body while he stood in front of her. This
lasted about 15-20 minutes. Youth A calmed and was released. Staff 1 contacted
the on-call who instructed Staff 1 to complete an incident report.
Interviews:
The Manager of Program Operations (Manager) was interviewed via telephone on
2/14/22. He stated he filed out the complaint form after talking to their consultant. He
stated it was Thursday or Friday that he submitted it. He was informed about the
hold on Monday 2/7/22 but the hold occurred the previous weekend. Staff 1
contacted the clinician on-call who told him to complete an incident report. Staff 1
completed an ABC (Antecedents, Behavior, Consequences) form instead. He
thought an incident report was completed and put in MiSACWIS. They have had
some concerns with Staff 1. He is currently being investigated for another incident.
They have already determined that he needs additional verbal de-escalation and
restraint training. He will not be involved in restraints until he is re-trained. Staff 1
was alone with the youth. Staff 2 was at the other end of the hallway working with
another escalated child. The Assistant Program Manager (APM) was in the building
at the time. The Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/15/22. He
was unable to locate an Incident Report.
On 2/15/22 an interview was attempted with Youth A at her school. When Youth A
came out of her classroom she ran around the building and would not return to be
interviewed. Another attempt was made on 2/25/22 however Youth A had left for a
visit.
The Assistant Program Manager (APM) was interviewed face to face at the facility
on 2/15/22. The APM worked the Sunday night Staff 1 restrained Youth A, but she
was never informed of the containment until the following Tuesday when she was
asked what happened. She reported she should have been notified of the
containment as she was the manager in the building. There is also a different
manager on-call.
3

The Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/15/22. She
reported Staff 1 has been re-trained in Handle with Care because the youth were
getting out of his holds. He does well with the youth and builds relationships with
them.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/18/22. He reported during the
incident on 2/6/22 there were only two staff working that were trained in Handle with
Care. He worked with Youth A while the other trained staff worked with Youth B.
Youth A had a plastic cup that she broke into pieces. She would not give him the
pieces and tried stabbing him with them. When she went to stab him, Staff 1 held
her wrists. He let go right away but she continued to try and stab him. He grabbed
her wrists again. He sat down with her, she de-escalated, and gave him the pieces
of plastic so he let her go. He stated he did not want to do the Handle With Care
hold because she would use the pieces to stab his sides. Staff 1 reported that in a
previous training they are taught to back away from a youth coming at them, but she
was also trying to stab herself, so he did not want to do that. He stated he could
have called another staff to assist. Staff 1 stated he met with the Manager to go over
the incident and he was re-trained in Handle With Care. Staff 1 acknowledged that
holding Youth A’s wrists was not a technique taught in Handle With Care.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/25/22. She reported she was
present for the incident on 2/6/22 with Youth A. She stated she was trying to calm
another youth when Staff 1 was addressing Youth A. Youth A had a broken cup in
her hand and was cutting herself. Staff 2 was not present for the entire incident, but
she did see that Staff 1 was holding Youth A's arms. Staff 1 was sitting on the floor
with Youth A and was not going to release her until she let go of the cup pieces.
Staff 2 could not see exactly how Staff 1 was holding Youth A's arms. Staff 2 then
went to get help.
Documents Reviewed:
 Youth A’s Case file: Youth A has a developmental disability. She is physically
aggressive towards others and threatens to hurt herself. She is easily
agitated.
 MiSACWIS Incident Reports: No report was found for 2/6/22.
 Incident Report: the report was not completed until after the on-site visit on
2/15/22. The report had the same information that was in the complaint and
Staff 1’s interview.
 ABC Form: Indicated the same information as the Incident Report.
 Resident Restraint Policy: Staff are only to utilize Handle With Care
techniques, an Incident Report must be completed before the end of the shift,
a manager must be notified of the restraint, and the restraint must be entered
into MiSACWIS within 24 hours.
 Handle With Care training materials: the technique Staff 1 indicated using on
Youth A was not one of the techniques outlined in the materials.
4

 Incident Reporting policy
 Staff 1 employee file: He completed Handle With Care training on 10/20/21
and 2/10/22. Staff 1 had a discipline in his file from 2/16/22 for not completing
an Incident Report as instructed for the incident on 2/6/22.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Resident restraint.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures regarding restraint. These
policies and procedures shall be available to all
residents, their families, and referring agencies.
ANALYSIS: The agency is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 did not follow
the facility’s restraint policy. He performed a technique not
taught by Handle With Care, he did not complete an incident
report until 2/15/22, he did not notify the manager in the
building, and because the incident report was not completed it
was not entered into MiSACWIS.
Technical Assistance:
The Incident Reporting policy needs to direct staff to contact
Central Intake if they suspect abuse/neglect.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that no
change be made to the license status of this Child Caring Institution.
